value.title: Power BI Icon Names for Conditional Formatting Using DAX
value.excerpt: I have previously written about conditional formatting in Power BI, and how you can take one step further with using DAX to dynamically change the conditional formatting. Conditional formatting with DAX for colors is easy, you can use the color name or their hex code. But for Icons, it is slightly different.

value.title: Discover data analysis
value.excerpt: Would you like to explore the journey of a data analyst and learn how a data analyst tells a story with data? In this module, you will explore the different roles in data and learn the different tasks of a data analyst.

value.title: Power BI Get Data: Import vs. DirectQuery vs. Live
value.excerpt: Import vs. DirectQuery vs. Live connection. Which do you choose and why in Power BI? Adam looks at the three options when creating reports in Power BI Desktop.   DirectQuery in SQL Server 2016 Analysis Services Whitepaper https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/analysisservices/2017/04/06/directquery-in-sql-server-2016-analysis-services-whitepaper/

value.title: Queso cabrales sales are OFF THE CHARTS, how do I visualize them? | Visualize outliers in Power BI
value.excerpt: In pandemic times some companies have done very good, others not so much but one thing they have in common, the oulier sales both negative or positive are making data visualization very hard.   How do we fix this? Here is one way!  Dumbbell chart in charticulator: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gz6v8EDbjsw&ab_channel=CurbalDataLabs

value.title: Vaccination Tracker Part1: Get data from github and schedule refresh it
value.excerpt: This video is part 1 of the upcoming series: How to create a Vaccine tracker.  In Part 1 we will get the data from Github, publish it to a PPU workspace (we will need that later) and show you how to schedule refresh it and what to do if the option is not available.  To get the files go to Curbal Download

value.excerpt: Patrick looks at a few data modeling best practices in Power BI and Analysis Services. These are things we see customers doing on a regular basis and you should be aware of it. value.title: Handling MULTIPLE fact tables in Power BI
value.excerpt: You've got multiple fact tables in your Power BI dataset. And, dimension tables for each. Struggling to slice and dice across both? Patrick shows you how to deal with this mess.  Understand star schema and the importance for Power BI https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/guidance/star-schema  📢 Become

value.title: Power BI Slicers vs Filters - which will you choose?
value.excerpt: Adam picks up on David Eldersveld's blog about Power BI slicers versus filters and looks at if slicers are even needed now. The filter pane can satisfy a majority of scenarios. There are a few that it can't. Which Power BI feature will you choose?  David Eldersveld blog - https://dataveld.com/2019/01/18/are-power-bi-slicers-still-relevant-with-the-new-filter-pane/

value.title: Prepare data for analysis
value.excerpt: Students will explore Power Query as they learn to extract data from different data sources and choose a storage mode and connectivity type. They will learn to profile, clean, and load data into Power BI in preparation for modeling their data.

topItems.title: Get data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: You will learn how to retrieve data from a wide variety of data sources, including Microsoft Excel, relational databases, and NoSQL data stores. You will also learn how to improve performance while retrieving data.

topItems.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Power Query has an incredible amount of features that are dedicated to helping you clean and prepare your data for analysis. You will learn how to simplify a complicated model, change data types, rename objects, and pivot data. You will also learn how to profile columns so that you know which columns have the valuable data that you’re seeking for deeper analytics.

value.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Power Query has an incredible amount of features that are dedicated to helping you clean and prepare your data for analysis. You will learn how to simplify a complicated model, change data types, rename objects, and pivot data. You will also learn how to profile columns so that you know which columns have the valuable data that you’re seeking for deeper analytics.

value.title: Get data with Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: How can you find, collect, and clean data from different sources? Power BI is a tool for making sense of your data. You will learn tricks to make data-gathering easier.

value.title: Power BI slicers vs the filter pane (2021)
value.excerpt: What's the difference between Power BI slicers and the Filter pane? The filter panel can satisfy a majority of scenarios. There are a few that it can't.
